qas.question: When did the The Neolithic 2 (PPNB) era start?

context: The Neolithic 2 (PPNB) began <a0_0><b4_0>around 8,800 BCE<b4_0/><a0_0/> according to the ASPRO chronology in the Levant (Jericho, Israel). As with the PPNA dates, there are two versions from the same laboratories noted above. This system of terminology, however, is not convenient for southeast Anatolia and settlements of the middle Anatolia basin. This era was before <a1_0>the <b5_0>Mesolithic era<b5_0/><a1_0/>.[citation needed] A settlement of <a2_0><b6_0>3,000 inhabitants<b6_0/><a2_0/> was found in the outskirts of Amman, Jordan. Considered to be one of the largest prehistoric settlements in the Near East, called <b7_0>'<a3_0>Ain Ghazal<b7_0/><a3_0/>, it was continuously inhabited from approximately <b8_0>7,250 – 5,000 B<b8_0/>.
